3901.definition: [παραῤῥυέω] from {{G3844}} and the alternate of {{G4482}}; to flow by, i.e. (figuratively) carelessly pass (miss)

3902.definition: [παράσημος] from {{G3844}} and the base of {{G4591}}; side-marked, i.e. labelled (with a badge (figure-head) of a ship)

3903.definition: [παρασκευάζω] from {{G3844}} and a derivative of {{G4632}}; to furnish aside, i.e. get ready

3905.definition: [παρατείνω] from {{G3844}} and teino (to stretch); to extend along, i.e. prolong (in point of time)

3906.definition: [παρατηρέω] from {{G3844}} and {{G5083}}; to inspect alongside, i.e. note insidiously or scrupulously

3908.definition: [παρατίθημι] from {{G3844}} and {{G5087}}; to place alongside, i.e. present (food, truth); by implication, to deposit (as a trust or for protection)

3909.definition: [παρατυγχάνω] from {{G3844}} and {{G5177}}; to chance near, i.e. fall in with

3910.definition: [παραυτίκα] from {{G3844}} and a derivative of {{G846}}; at the very instant, i.e. momentary

3911.definition: [παραφέρω] from {{G3844}} and {{G5342}} (including its alternate forms); to bear along or aside, i.e. carry off (literally or figuratively); by implication, to avert

3912.definition: [παραφρονέω] from {{G3844}} and {{G5426}}; to misthink, i.e. be insane (silly)

3914.definition: [παραχειμάζω] from {{G3844}} and {{G5492}}; to winter near, i.e. stay with over the rainy season

3916.definition: [παραχρῆμα] from {{G3844}} and {{G5536}} (in its original sense); at the thing itself, i.e. instantly

3917.definition: [πάρδαλις] feminine of πάρδος (a panther); a leopard

3918.definition: [πάρειμι] from {{G3844}} and {{G1510}} (including its various forms); to be near, i.e. at hand; neuter present participle (singular) time being, or (plural) property

3919.definition: [παρεισάγω] from {{G3844}} and {{G1521}}; to lead in aside, i.e. introduce surreptitiously

3921.definition: [παρεισδύνω] from {{G3844}} and a compound of {{G1519}} and {{G1416}}; to settle in alongside, i.e. lodge stealthily

3922.definition: [παρεισέρχομαι] from {{G3844}} and {{G1525}}; to come in alongside, i.e. supervene additionally or steathily

3923.definition: [παρεισφέρω] from {{G3844}} and {{G1533}}; to bear in alongside, i.e. introduce simultaneously

3924.definition: [παρεκτός] from {{G3844}} and {{G1622}}; near outside, i.e. besides

3925.definition: [παρεμβολή] from a compound of {{G3844}} and {{G1685}}; a throwing in beside (juxtaposition), i.e. (specially), battle-array, encampment or barracks (tower Antonia)

3926.definition: [παρενοχλέω] from {{G3844}} and {{G1776}}; to harass further, i.e. annoy

3927.definition: [παρεπίδημος] from {{G3844}} and the base of {{G1927}}; an alien alongside, i.e. a resident foreigner

3928.definition: [παρέρχομαι] from {{G3844}} and {{G2064}}; to come near or aside, i.e. to approach (arrive), go by (or away), (figuratively) perish or neglect, (causative) avert

3930.definition: [παρέχω] from {{G3844}} and {{G2192}}; to hold near, i.e. present, afford, exhibit, furnish occasion

3931.definition: [παρηγορία] from a compound of {{G3844}} and a derivative of {{G58}} (meaning to harangue an assembly); an address alongside, i.e. (specially), consolation

3933.definition: [παρθένος] of unknown origin; a maiden; by implication, an unmarried daughter

3934.definition: [Πάρθος] probably of foreign origin; a Parthian, i.e. inhabitant of Parthia

3935.definition: [παρίημι] from {{G3844}} and hiemi (to send); to let by, i.e. relax

3936.definition: [παρίστημι] , or prolonged      παριστάνωfrom {{G3844}} and {{G2476}}; to stand beside, i.e. (transitively) to exhibit, proffer, (specially), recommend, (figuratively) substantiate; or (intransitively) to be at hand (or ready), aid

3937.definition: [Παρμενᾶς] probably by contraction for Παρμενίδης (a derivative of a compound of {{G3844}} and {{G3306}}); constant; Parmenas, a Christian

3938.definition: [πάροδος] from {{G3844}} and {{G3598}}; a by-road, i.e. (actively) a route

3939.definition: [παροικέω] from {{G3844}} and {{G3611}}; to dwell near, i.e. reside as a foreigner

3941.definition: [πάροικος] from {{G3844}} and {{G3624}}; having a home near, i.e. (as noun) a by-dweller (alien resident)

3942.definition: [παροιμία] from a compound of {{G3844}} and perhaps a derivative of {{G3633}}; apparently a state alongside of supposition, i.e. (concretely) an adage; specially, an enigmatical or fictitious illustration

3943.definition: [πάροινος] from {{G3844}} and {{G3631}}; staying near wine, i.e. tippling (a toper)

3944.definition: [παροίχομαι] from {{G3844}} and οἴχομαι (to depart); to escape along, i.e. be gone

3946.definition: [παρόμοιος] from {{G3844}} and {{G3664}}; alike nearly, i.e. similar

3947.definition: [παροξύνω] from {{G3844}} and a derivative of {{G3691}}; to sharpen alongside, i.e. (figuratively) to exasperate

3948.definition: [παροξυσμός] from {{G3947}} ("paroxysm"); incitement (to good), or dispute (in anger)

3949.definition: [παροργίζω] from {{G3844}} and {{G3710}}; to anger alongside, i.e. enrage

3951.definition: [παροτρύνω] from {{G3844}} and ὀτρύνω (to spur); to urge along, i.e. stimulate (to hostility)

3952.definition: [παρουσία] from the present participle of {{G3918}}; a being near, i.e. advent (often, return; specially, of Christ to punish Jerusalem, or finally the wicked); (by implication) physically, aspect

3953.definition: [παροψίς] from {{G3844}} and the base of {{G3795}}; a side-dish (the receptacle)

3954.definition: [παῤῥησία] from {{G3956}} and a derivative of {{G4483}}; all out-spokenness, i.e. frankness, bluntness, publicity; by implication, assurance

3955.definition: [παῤῥησιάζομαι] middle voice from {{G3954}}; to be frank in utterance, or confident in spirit and demeanor

3956.definition: [πᾶς] including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole

3957.definition: [πάσχα] of Chaldee origin (compare {{H6453}}); the Passover (the meal, the day, the festival or the special sacrifices connected with it)

3958.definition: [πάσχω] , including the forms      πάθω,  and      πένθω, used only in certain tenses for it apparently a primary verb; to experience a sensation or impression (usually painful)

3959.definition: [Πάταρα] probably of foreign origin; Patara, a place in Asia Minor

3960.definition: [πατάσσω] probably prolongation from {{G3817}}; to knock (gently or with a weapon or fatally) Compare {{G5180}}.

3961.definition: [πατέω] from a derivative probably of {{G3817}} (meaning a "path"); to trample (literally or figuratively)

3962.definition: [πατήρ] apparently a primary word; a "father" (literally or figuratively, near or more remote)

3963.definition: [Πάτμος] of uncertain derivation; Patmus, an islet in the Mediterranean

3964.definition: [πατραλῴας] from {{G3962}} and the same as the latter part of {{G3389}}; a parricide

3965.definition: [πατριά] as if feminine of a derivative of {{G3962}}; paternal descent, i.e. (concretely) a group of families or a whole race (nation)

3968.definition: [πατρίς] from {{G3902}}; a father-land, i.e. native town; (figuratively) heavenly home

3969.definition: [Πατροβᾶς] perhaps a contraction for Πατρόβιος (a compound of {{G3962}} and {{G979}}); father's life; Patrobas, a Christian

3970.definition: [πατροπαράδοτος] from {{G3962}} and a derivative of {{G3860}} (in the sense of handing over or down); traditionary

3972.definition: [Παῦλος] of Latin origin; (little; but remotely from a derivative of {{G3973}}, meaning the same); Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle

3973.definition: [παύω] a primary verb ("pause"); to stop (transitively or intransitively), i.e. restrain, quit, desist, come to an end

3974.definition: [Πάφος] of uncertain derivation; Paphus, a place in Cyprus

3975.definition: [παχύνω] from a derivative of {{G4078}} (meaning thick); to thicken, i.e. (by implication) to fatten (figuratively, stupefy or render callous)

3976.definition: [πέδη] ultimately from {{G4228}}; a shackle for the feet

3977.definition: [πεδινός] from a derivative of {{G4228}} (meaning the ground); level (as easy for the feet)

3978.definition: [πεζεύω] from the same as {{G3979}}; to foot a journey, i.e. travel by land

3979.definition: [πεζῇ] dative case feminine of a derivative of {{G4228}} (as adverb); foot-wise, i.e. by walking

3980.definition: [πειθαρχέω] from a compound of {{G3982}} and {{G757}}; to be persuaded by a ruler, i.e. (genitive case) to submit to authority; by analogy, to conform to advice

3982.definition: [πείθω] a primary verb; to convince (by argument, true or false); by analogy, to pacify or conciliate (by other fair means); reflexively or passively, to assent (to evidence or authority), to rely (by inward certainty)

3983.definition: [πεινάω] from the same as {{G3993}} (through the idea of pinching toil; "pine"); to famish (absolutely or comparatively); figuratively, to crave

3984.definition: [πεῖρα] from the base of {{G4008}} (through the idea of piercing); a test, i.e. attempt, experience

3985.definition: [πειράζω] from {{G3984}}; to test (objectively), i.e. endeavor, scrutinize, entice, discipline

3986.definition: [πειρασμός] from {{G3985}}; a putting to proof (by experiment (of good), experience (of evil), solicitation, discipline or provocation); by implication, adversity

3987.definition: [πειράω] from {{G3984}}; to test (subjectively), i.e. (reflexively) to attempt

3988.definition: [πεισμονή] from a presumed derivative of {{G3982}}; persuadableness, i.e. credulity

3989.definition: [πέλαγος] of uncertain affinity; deep or open sea, i.e. the main

3990.definition: [πελεκίζω] from a derivative of {{G4141}} (meaning an axe); to chop off (the head), i.e. truncate

3992.definition: [πέμπω] apparently a primary verb; to dispatch (from the subjective view or point of departure, whereas ἵημι (as a stronger form of εἶμι) refers rather to the objective point or , and {{G4724}} denotes properly, the orderly motion involved), especially on a temporary errand; also to transmit, bestow, or wield

3993.definition: [πένης] from a primary πένω (to toil for daily subsistence); starving, i.e. indigent Compare {{G4434}}.

3995.definition: [πενθερός] of uncertain affinity; a wife's father

3996.definition: [πενθέω] from {{G3997}}; to grieve (the feeling or the act)

3997.definition: [πένθος] strengthened from the alternate of {{G3958}}; grief

3998.definition: [πενιχρός] prolongation from the base of {{G3993}}; necessitous

4000.definition: [πεντακισχίλιοι] from {{G3999}} and {{G5507}}; five times a thousand
